quote: Age ... is a matter of feeling, not of years.
author: Curtis, George Williams

quote: The Border Ballads, for instance, and the Robin Hood Ballads, clearly suppose a state of society which is nothing but a very circumscribed and not very important heroic age.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

quote: I was always concerned with writing to my age at a particular moment. That was the way I would keep faith with the audience that supported me as I went along.
author: Bruce Springsteen

quote: Old age: I fall asleep during the funerals of my friends.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: The kids are old enough now - I just want to let them be kids. I don't want to comment on them too much. They're at an age where I just want to let them be kids.
author: Eminem

quote: I've spent as much as 30 grand on a watch but it's not about flaunting my wealth. I don't have many extravagances but watches are my biggest one. I must have 30 of them now. I've been collecting since the age of nine, when I won a black TAG in a karting event.
author: Jenson Button

quote: I never took guitar lessons. I took classical piano lessons from the age of six when we lived in Holland. And when we moved to America, it was just the typical thing except I was really good at it so was my brother.
author: Eddie Van Halen

quote: No matter what age you are, or what your circumstances might be, you are special, and you still have something unique to offer. Your life, because of who you are, has meaning.
author: Barbara de Angelis

quote: The nearer people approach old age the closer they return to a semblance of childhood, until the time comes for them to depart this life, again like children, neither tired of living nor aware of death.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: I was always an early riser.  Happy the man who is!  Every morning day comes to him with a virgin's love, full of bloom and freshness.  The youth of nature is contagious, like the gladness of a happy child.
author: Bulwer-Lytton, Edward Robert

quote: A stockbroker urged me to buy a stock that would triple its value every year. I told him, 'At my age, I don't even buy green bananas.'
author: Claude Pepper

quote: I'm now at the age where I've got to prove that I'm just as good as I never was.
author: Harrison, Rex

quote: Why should society feel responsible only for the education of children, and not for the education of all adults of every age?
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Every age yearns for a more beautiful world. The deeper the desperation and the depression about the confusing present, the more intense that yearning.
author: Johan Huizinga

quote: The real sadness of fifty is not that you change so much but that you change so little.
author: Max Lerner

quote: Intelligent life on a planet comes of age when it first works out the reason for its own existence.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: To own the dominant, or only, newspaper in a mid-sized American city was, for many decades, a kind of license to print money. In the Internet age, however, no one has figured out how to rescue the newspaper in the United States or abroad.
author: Eric Alterman

quote: I was taught from a young age that many people would treat me as a second-class citizen because I was African-American and because I was female.
author: Queen Latifah

quote: I was very sexual from a very young age.
author: Portia de Rossi

quote: Age is not all decay it is the ripening, the swelling, of the fresh life within, that withers and bursts the husk.
author: George MacDonald

quote: I ask you to pray for me, for once age has overtaken us, we find consolation only in religion.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: We grew up in a very creative environment and were exposed to the arts at a very young age, so it's not a surprise that all of us are in some form of the arts.
author: Spike Lee

quote: I grew up on the golden age of children's TV.
author: Edward Norton

quote: I've never worried about age.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: You are 27 or 28 right? It is very tough to live at that age. When nothing is sure. I have sympathy with you.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: The sanitary and mechanical age we are now entering makes up for the mercy it grants to our sense of smell by the ferocity with which it assails our sense of hearing.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Life, an age to the miserable, and a moment to the happy.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Starting a new retirement plan for those below a certain age is something tens of millions of Americans have already been through at work.
author: Mitch Daniels

quote: I feel like a lot of the female relationships I see on TV or in movies are in some way free of the kind of jealousy and anxiety and posturing that has been such a huge part of my female friendships, which I hope lessens a little bit with age.
author: Lena Dunham

quote: People dance at any age.
author: Mikhail Baryshnikov

quote: Middle age is when you're sitting at home on a Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Women lie about their age men lie about their income.
author: William Feather

quote: This is what I asked for, and in this day and age that's what actually goes on. But what hurts me the most is that I work just as hard as any other actress around my age, like Scarlett Johansson, but I just don't get the opportunities that they get because people are so distracted by the mess that I created in my life.
author: Lindsay Lohan

quote: I would often find myself, at the age of 21, at midnight, running down a dark street on my own with 10 men chasing me. And the fact they had cameras in their hands made that legal.
author: Sienna Miller

quote: Having come to live in this age is as though one were to have entered another country. Learn its language or risk being left out.
author: Theodore Bikel

quote: It is old age, rather than death, that is to be contrasted with life. Old age is life's parody, whereas death transforms life into a destiny: in a way it preserves it by giving it the absolute dimension. Death does away with time.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: People pay to see movies with women looking beautiful, but I think there will be a place for me to play women looking my own age.
author: Debra Winger

quote: As men get older, the toys get more expensive.
author: Marvin Davis

quote: I think the most exciting thing is that you expect people our age to know the music, but actually a lot of kids know the music, and if anything is left, we have left really good music, and that's the important part, not the mop-tops or whatever.
author: Ringo Starr

quote: We were making the first step out of the age of chemistry and physics, and into the age of biology.
author: Jeremy Rifkin

quote: I never played much golf as a kid. I caddied quite a bit but never got serious into golf until about age 15.
author: Lee Trevino

quote: I would often find myself, at the age of 21, at midnight, running down a dark street on my own with 10 men chasing me. And the fact they had cameras in their hands made that legal.
author: Sienna Miller

quote: Every time I see something terrible, it's like I see it at age 19. I keep a freshness that way.
author: Ralph Nader

quote: Age is how we determine how valuable you are.
author: Jane Elliot

quote: One of my grandfathers, actually, having gone out there as a minister, decided he would better serve the people as a doctor. So at a very late age - at the age of 38 in fact - he changed course and decided to become a doctor.
author: Colin Firth

quote: Almost all of your life is lived by the seat of your pants, one unexpected event crashing into another, with no pattern or reason, and then you finally reach a point, around my age, where you spend more time than ever looking back. Why did this happen? Look where that led? You see the shape of things.
author: Ron Perlman

quote: A man's only as old as the woman he feels.
author: Marx, Groucho

quote: I'd always thought the Rats were good fun, but one of the very nice things about being of Saga age is that I can actually look back and think, When I was younger I was in a great band. It was always a collective thing.
author: Bob Geldof

quote: Listen, in England people are already writing their memoirs at the age of 23.
author: Rupert Everett

quote: In the age of television, image becomes more important than substance.
author: S. I. Hayakawa

quote: You are capable of more than you know. Choose a goal that seems right for you and strive to be the best, however hard the path. Aim high. Behave honorably. Prepare to be alone at times, and to endure failure. Persist! The world needs all you can give.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: No employer today is independent of those about him. He cannot succeed alone, no matter how great his ability or capital. Business today is more than ever a question of cooperation.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: To be adult is to be alone.
author: Jean Rostand

quote: Even though I love solar and love wind, like most people do, I like the renewable sources, they alone are not going to get America energy independent.
author: Mitt Romney

quote: No one else can take risks for us, or face our losses on our behalf, or give us self-esteem. No one can spare us from life's slings and arrows, and when death comes, we meet it alone.
author: Martha Beck

quote: I'm single, footloose and fancy free, I have no responsibilities, no anchors. Work, friendship and self-improvement, that's me.
author: Joel Edgerton

quote: Don't ever let economic alone determine your career or how you spend the majority of your time.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: It's important to say that actors can't act alone, it's impossible. What we have to do is support each other.
author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

quote: Man's ultimate concern must be expressed symbolically, because symbolic language alone is able to express the ultimate.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: This avidity alone, of acquiring goods and possessions for ourselves and our nearest friends, is insatiable, perpetual, universal, and directly destructive of society.
author: David Hume

quote: I finally faced the fact that it isn't a crime not having friends. Being alone means you have fewer problems.
author: Whitney Houston

quote: I try to push ideas away, and the ones that will not leave me alone are the ones that ultimately end up happening.
author: J. J. Abrams

quote: It's an amazing feeling to go into a studio and really be alone.
author: Joaquin Phoenix

quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Those who remember Washington's cold war culture in the 1980s will recall the shocked reactions to Reagan's intervention. People interested in foreign policy were astonished when in 1985 he met alone at Geneva - alone, not a single strategic thinker at his elbow! - with the Soviet Communist master Gorbachev.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Mass transportation is doomed to failure in North America because a person's car is the only place where he can be alone and think.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: But it seems that the judging maybe they shouldn't at least see the practices all week long. That can taint the way they go into the judging and the outlook of what's going to happen, instead of just watching those four minutes and judging on those minutes alone.
author: Nancy Kerrigan

quote: Some people can sometimes really invade your space and kind of never leave you alone.
author: Julia Louis-Dreyfus

quote: A well-instructed people alone can be permanently a free people.
author: James Madison

quote: I love the solitude of being on a plane and finally getting to read an entire book and being left alone.
author: Christina Ricci

quote: In the first 50 years of the filibuster, it was used only 35 times. But the last Congress alone had 112 cloture motions filed, plus threats of more. This is the tyranny of the minority.
author: Peter Fenn

quote: However, anyone to whom this happens should not leave his room upon awakening, should speak to no-one, but remain alone and sober until everything comes back to him, and he recalls the dream.
author: Paracelsus

quote: It is clear that not in one thing alone, but in many ways equality and freedom of speech are a good thing.
author: Herodotus

quote: We allow our ignorance to prevail upon us and make us think we can survive alone, alone in patches, alone in groups, alone in races, even alone in genders.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I'm single, footloose and fancy free, I have no responsibilities, no anchors. Work, friendship and self-improvement, that's me.
author: Joel Edgerton

quote: I paint self-portraits because I am so often alone, because I am the person I know best.
author: Frida Kahlo

quote: I think Mr. Wilson will have to be the rest of the way alone.
author: Flip Wilson

quote: This, then, is the test we must set for ourselves not to march alone but to march in such a way that others will wish to join us.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: What a lovely surprise to finally discover how unlonely being alone can be.
author: Ellen Burstyn

quote: I very much wished not to be noticed, and to be left alone, and I sort of succeeded.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: It's better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone - so far.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I don't want to be alone, I want to be left alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: I know that books I have written will still resonate in 50 years - particularly 'My Sister's Keeper.' It has sold three million copies in the States alone. I strongly feel that, as a novelist, you have a platform and the ability to change people's minds.
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: The majority does not rule in America, but the minority shouldn't hijack it. And it's because we're afraid. They have isolated us and made us feel as though we're alone. We're not.
author: Glenn Beck

quote: I talked about the barriers created by monopolies. I said that it was the role of government to break up these monopolies and that we couldn't do it alone.
author: Joichi Ito

quote: I'm so accustomed to being alone.
author: Leighton Meester

quote: Our language has wisely sensed the two sides of being alone. It has created the word loneliness to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word solitude to express the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: I am alone, some people help me, but, basically, I can do what I want.
author: Sergei Bubka

quote: An artist is always alone - if he is an artist. No, what the artist needs is loneliness.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The English Bible - a book which, if everything else in our language should perish, would alone suffice to show the whole extent of its beauty and power.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: No one should be left to suffer alone.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Nothing else so destroys the power to stand alone as the habit of leaning upon others. If you lean, you will never be strong or original. Stand alone or bury your ambition to be somebody in the world.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Look, if I were alone in the world, I would have the right to choose despair, solitude and self-fulfillment. But I am not alone.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: A steady patriot of the world alone, The friend of every country but his own.
author: George Canning

quote: Americans different in some maybe thoughts or emphasis still have the same ideas. They want a government that lets them be free, that leaves them alone, that doesn't interrupt and interfere with every aspect of their life, that lets them go to work and keep more of what they've worked hard to have.
author: Mike Huckabee

quote: Some people can sometimes really invade your space and kind of never leave you alone.
author: Julia Louis-Dreyfus

quote: Show me a man who lives alone and has a perpetually clean kitchen, and 8 times out of 9 I'll show you a man with detestable spiritual qualities.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: When one by one our ties are torn, and friend from friend is snatched forlorn when man is left alone to mourn, oh! then how sweet it is to die!
author: Anna Letitia Barbauld

quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: It's amazing what you can get on open source now if you actually use the right search engines to find the material.
author: Gus O'Donnell

quote: The business that people do in LA on the social level is amazing. You go to a restaurant, bump into this guy or that guy. The next day you get a call, and they want you in their movie.
author: Kevin Bacon

quote: I seriously love to cook... My grandmother was an amazing cook. As a kid I used to help her make handmade pasta, Cavatelli and Ravioli. It was one of my favorite things to do. I love the idea of making whatever is in the fridge into something.
author: Bradley Cooper

quote: It's amazing how quickly people on the internet can pick something up, but it's also amazing how quickly they can drop it.
author: Tim Berners Lee

quote: I'm one of those people that thinks the Internet is amazing, and I can't believe it exists.
author: Mayim Bialik

quote: You get moments all the time that kind of make you pinch yourself, some of them make you quite emotional. Winning a BRIT was a big moment because we were just so excited to be at the awards in the first place. Selling out Madison Square Garden was pretty amazing too. Then we woke to the news that our UK tour was sold out. It was crazy.
author: Harry Styles

quote: I discovered something amazing, which has caused a lot of controversy - the fountain of youth. I have to keep it a secret!
author: David Copperfield

quote: I've had to calm down, I have a kid! It is amazing. It's the best thing ever. Nothing better than it.
author: Kevin Pietersen

quote: The feeling of your baby taking nourishment from your body for the first time is amazing, and it remains the most touching moment of my life.
author: Laura Schlessinger

quote: I auditioned for 'Girls' the fall after I graduated from Yale. The show has been amazing - as close to perfect as it gets!
author: Allison Williams

quote: I'd said to my sweetheart a couple of days before that the SAG and Spirit Award nomination was amazing and I had no attachment to the Academy Award. I knew I was an underdog so I just decided to sleep through the announcement.
author: John Hawkes

quote: I have two younger sisters and I'm such an advocate of owning who you are as a person. Don't be ashamed or intimidated. Never feel like you are not amazing.
author: Khloe Kardashian

quote: It's amazing... to enjoy the results of your labor.
author: Michael Rady

quote: It's been amazing how this crazy career has been created. I feel that it's been given to me. I wouldn't be anywhere without Victoria's Secret.
author: Candice Swanepoel

quote: The body is an amazing machine... If you eat the right things your body will perform incredibly well!
author: Shawn Johnson

quote: Walmart is an amazing story of entrepreneurship and, as one of the world's most powerful brands, touches millions of lives every day.
author: Marissa Mayer

quote: To make a couple putts to win the Masters is just an amazing feeling.
author: Adam Derek Scott

quote: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: I was always amazed about how much I could finally squeeze into a thirty second commercial.
author: Ridley Scott

quote: I've also long since realized that the way to really engage children is to give out prizes it's amazing how it concentrates their minds.
author: Alexander McCall Smith

quote: I'm a big fan of Mashable and TechCrunch and other outlets like that, but TechMeme obviously does an amazing job of aggregating.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

quote: I work with all these amazing voice actors that do a kajillion voices.
author: Katey Sagal

quote: It's an amazing feeling to go into a studio and really be alone.
author: Joaquin Phoenix

quote: It's amazing how a competitive nature can turn a negative into something positive.
author: Barry Mann

quote: I had one drama teacher who was amazing, Ms. Perkins. She really tried to inspire me and get me going.
author: Carlos Pena, Jr.

quote: It's been such a deep and amazing journey for me, getting close to John Keats, and also I love Shelley and Byron. I mean, the thing about the Romantic poets is that they've got the epitaph of romantic posthumously. They all died really young, and Keats, the youngest of them all.
author: Jane Campion

quote: My mom is a really good cook. I didn't get the cooking gene, but she cooks this really amazing dinner every Christmas, and that's always really fun.
author: Miranda Cosgrove

quote: Science fiction is an amazing literature: plot elements that you would think would be completely worn out by now keep changing into surprising new forms.
author: Connie Willis

quote: Well, what I love about '80s rock music is the amazing, fantastic melodies.
author: Julianne Hough

quote: I started crying the other day just thinking that the baby is going to leave me soon! You have this relationship with this person in your belly and it's really amazing.
author: Emily Procter

quote: I get to travel around the world and meet all of these amazing people, and they're singing my songs! And to me, that's crazy.
author: Kina Grannis

quote: I have a ridiculous fear of sharks but I'd jump in the water in a second for an amazing role.
author: Kate Mara

quote: Steven Tyler is awesome. He is so humble. He's really sweet and coming from him and his career, it's amazing.
author: Ashthon Jones

quote: What do I think of L.A.? It's boring, with some amazing nuggets. Like there are some parts of it that are great, but by and large I think it's quite boring.
author: Jemaine Clement

quote: I'm an actor, so sometimes there are moments where I think about everything that's happening and I want to cry. I'm doing what I love and I will be doing it for a very, very long time - and it's amazing. A lot of people don't get to do that.
author: Ashley Greene

quote: I decided to give acting a serious, committed try, and soon after, I read the script for 'Lovely and Amazing.' The story was beautiful and honest, and the characters struggled with the same insecurities many women - including me - face. I didn't think I had a chance in hell of being in the film, but I knew I had to go for it.
author: Emily Mortimer

quote: The amount of control you have over somebody if you can monitor internet activity is amazing.
author: Tim Berners Lee

quote: The last real movie stars were probably Redford and Newman. And things were different then. There wasn't this amazing amount of magazines and information about them.
author: George Clooney

quote: I enjoy looking at words on paper and visualizing how to make them come to life. As a director, the creative process is really amazing.
author: Alfonso Ribeiro

quote: I get such lovely gifts from fans... amazing pictures, handmade jewellery. I'm very lucky!
author: Leona Lewis

quote: What do I think of L.A.? It's boring, with some amazing nuggets. Like there are some parts of it that are great, but by and large I think it's quite boring.
author: Jemaine Clement

quote: As a planning board commissioner, I have to review the applications for development throughout the city, and the bulk of those applications have been for the waterfront. I think the progress the waterfront has made is amazing.
author: Vincent Frank

quote: Theatre, when it is at its best, takes a lot of beating - the live experience and the shared collective experience of live storytelling is really special when it is good. Particularly here in New York because the audiences are amazing, very vocal and very engaged, and that makes theatre very exciting.
author: Dan Stevens

quote: To go to the Oscars for 'Moneyball' - that was pretty amazing.
author: Chris Pratt

quote: Being on 'Glee' was amazing. I remember my first day on set, my first day I arrived to the set I was in my trailer and all of the actors came and banged on my door - Lea Michele, Chris Colfer, Amber Riley, Naya Rivera. They all welcomed me with open arms, so it was a great experience. It felt like family, and I miss them a lot over there.
author: NeNe Leakes

quote: I've done my best to work from a place of humility - always looking over your shoulder saying, 'Does this suck?' and I think that's a good way to work. The other way to work is where you start to think, 'I'm on fire, I'm amazing!' and I don't think that's the way to work.
author: David O. Russell

quote: I know some of my parents' friends think 'Little Britain' is in incredibly poor taste. But swimming the Channel? You can't really say anything negative about that, can you? There's nothing better than making your parents happy. The glee on my father's face that day was amazing.
author: David Walliams

quote: Words to me were magic. You could say a word and it could conjure up all kinds of images or feelings or a chilly sensation or whatever. It was amazing to me that words had this power.
author: Amy Tan

quote: With love, you should go ahead and take the risk of getting hurt because love is an amazing feeling.
author: Britney Spears

quote: Some of the most amazing human beings on the face of the planet go to sci-fi conventions, although I'm sure a few of them wouldn't admit it.
author: Richard Hatch

quote: Take the high road. No matter how much strife, and consternation, frustration and anger you might be confronted with - don't go to that level.
author: Tim Gunn

quote: The quickest way to defuse fear or insecurity or anger is usually humor. I think comics figure that out quickly, and, once you figure it out, you think, 'Hey, if I can do this and get paid, that would be kind of cool.'
author: Billy Gardell

quote: The nice thing about anger is that, as an emotion, it's strong enough to unplug me from the comedian's mind for a minute and just be a frustrated member of the citizenry.
author: Seth Meyers

quote: Shock, confusion, fear, anger, grief, and defiance. On Sept. 11, 2001, and for the three days following the worst terrorist attack on U.S. soil, President George W. Bush led with raw emotion that reflected the public's whipsawing stages of acceptance.
author: Ron Fournier

quote: He that would be angry and sin not, must not be angry with anything but sin.
author: John Ruskin

quote: With Stacy, it was interesting because you know he was within all this chaos, all these different lives that were so broken and so much anger and so much frustration and their skating came out of that, their different styles came out of that.
author: John Robinson

quote: At the time, 1980, people regarded actresses involved with production with a certain amount of fear, resentment and anger.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: The anger that appears to be building up between the sexes becomes more virulent with every day that passes. And far from women taking the blame... the fact is that men are invariably portrayed as the bad guys. Being a good man is like being a good Nazi.
author: Dave Thomas

quote: I don't play pyrotechnic scales. I play about frustration, patience, anger. Music is an extension of my soul.
author: Dick Dale

quote: I think I'm basically the same guy I always was. Maybe I've learned, through experience, to rein in some of the anger and temper they say redheads normally have.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: I've learned that football sometimes was an outlet. It was a way for me to release anger, release frustration.
author: Emmitt Smith

quote: All who consult on doubtful matters, should be void of hatred, friendship, anger, and pity.
author: Sallust

quote: I know, to banish anger altogether from one's breast is a difficult task. It cannot be achieved through pure personal effort. It can be done only by God's grace.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: You must never be satisfied with losing. You must get angry, terribly angry, about losing. But the mark of the good loser is that he takes his anger out on himself and not his victorious opponents or on his teammates.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger give, if thou art asked for little by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
author: Confucius

quote: And we know there has been horrendous loss of life and suffering and we know that there is anger. Anyone who came anywhere near the general election in constituencies with a substantial Muslim population knows that.
author: Clare Short

quote: But one of the hardest things for me to do was to access anger. I could do it on stage. But when I did it on film it was hard for me. That probably has to do with the intimacy of film. And my own personal issues with expressing anger. So I had to learn how to do that.
author: Ellen Barkin

quote: What influenced me was Tori Amos, who was unapologetic about expressing anger through music, and Sinead O'Connor. Those two in particular were really moving for me, and very inspiring, before I wrote 'Jagged Little Pill.'
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: I have to say that anger is the blanket that comes around me, and that blunts and blurs my sense of proportion.
author: Pete Townshend

quote: Us investigators who went out into the field were faced on occasion with a lot of anger, by people saying why has it taken you five or six year to come and see me?
author: Tony Greig

quote: Acting in anger and hatred throughout my life, I frequently precipitated what I feared most, the loss of friendships and the need to rely upon the very people I'd abused.
author: Luke Ford

quote: The more anger towards the past you carry in your heart, the less capable you are of loving in the present.
author: Barbara de Angelis

quote: It is only with burning anger that we can speak of this attack by counter-revolutionary reactionary elements against the capital of our country, against our people's democratic order and the power of the working class.
author: Janos Kadar

quote: Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: He best keeps from anger who remembers that God is always looking upon him.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Usually when people are sad, they don't do anything. They just cry over their condition. But when they get angry, they bring about a change.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: What starts the process, really, are laughs and slights and snubs when you are a kid. If your anger is deep enough and strong enough, you learn that you can change those attitudes by excellence, personal gut performance.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: You've just got to have a sense of respect for the person you have children with. Anger doesn't help anybody. Ultimately you have to say forgiveness is important, and honoring what you had together is important. But it's easy to say and harder to do.
author: Nicole Kidman

quote: I've been trying to learn how to not be so conflicted about things like my own anger. I've always had a place in my music for my anger as a way of compensating for not having a mechanism to express it in my everyday life. So I've been trying to be more true to myself, and that helps me to chill out a little bit. But politically, uh-uh. No.
author: Ani DiFranco

quote: I know of no more disagreeable situation than to be left feeling generally angry without anybody in particular to be angry at.
author: Frank Moore Colby

quote: Anger's not a good emotion.
author: Lincoln Chafee

quote: It's a joke to think that anyone is one thing. We're all such complex creatures. But if I'm going to be a poster child for anything, anger's a gorgeous emotion. It gets a bad rap, but it can make great changes happen.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: How often it is that the angry man rages denial of what his inner self is telling him.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: Beware of him that is slow to anger for when it is long coming, it is the stronger when it comes, and the longer kept. Abused patience turns to fury.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: The one who cannot restrain their anger will wish undone, what their temper and irritation prompted them to do.
author: Horace

quote: I also had to work through the violation of my date rape, my unhealthy relationships with men, my anger toward the people involved in the scandal, and those who exploited me afterwards.
author: Donna Rice

quote: On banks, I make no apology for attacking spivs and gamblers who did more harm to the British economy than Bob Crow could achieve in his wildest Trotskyite fantasies, while paying themselves outrageous bonuses underwritten by the taxpayer. There is much public anger about banks and it is well deserved.
author: Vince Cable

quote: Men make angry music and it's called rock-and-roll women include anger in their vocabulary and suddenly they're angry and militant.
author: Ani DiFranco

quote: Keep your temper. A decision made in anger is never sound.
author: Ford Frick

quote: The upside to anger? Getting it out of your system. You got to express your anger. Then you have room for more positive things. If I hold something in a long time, and then I speak it, it's amazing how the light shines so much brighter.
author: Reba McEntire

quote: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers, for each rage leaves him less than he had been before - it takes something from him.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Anger may repast with thee for an hour, but not repose for a night the continuance of anger is hatred, the continuance of hatred turns malice.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: My anger with the US was not at first, that they had used that weapon - although that anger came later.
author: Wilfred Burchett

quote: I was able to do To Sleep with Anger, a very powerful film about African Americans, their spirituality, and the things that happened within a small community and a family.
author: Danny Glover

quote: The anger that appears to be building up between the sexes becomes more virulent with every day that passes. And far from women taking the blame... the fact is that men are invariably portrayed as the bad guys. Being a good man is like being a good Nazi.
author: Dave Thomas

quote: Violence is a problem we all want to solve. I want to make sure that kids learn to deal with anger by learning how to talk with people to solve problems. Here in the United States Senate I want to make sure we have safe schools, safe neighborhoods and good things for kids to do after school!
author: Patty Murray

quote: Growing up in a particular neighborhood, growing up in a working-class family, not having much money, all of those things fire you and can give you an edge, can give you an anger.
author: Gary Oldman

quote: In a controversy the instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves.
author: Buddha

quote: I've always turned my anger inwards towards self-destruction.
author: Mackenzie Phillips

quote: If either player abandon the game by quitting the table in anger, or in an otherwise offensive manner or by momentarily resigning the game or refuses to abide by the decision of the Umpire, the game must be scored against him.
author: Howard Staunton

quote: Every great architect is - necessarily - a great poet. He must be a great original interpreter of his time, his day, his age.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: So what we have tried to do in our later buildings is to try to be completely consistent, as a painter is consistent or as a sculptor is consistent. Architecture also must be very consistent.
author: Minoru Yamasaki

quote: I would fix other people's lines if they asked me on occasion. The hard part of writing is the architecture of it, getting the story and structuring it. Not the tweaking of lines.
author: William Devane

quote: Building art is a synthesis of life in materialised form. We should try to bring in under the same hat not a splintered way of thinking, but all in harmony together.
author: Alvar Aalto

quote: The Romans were not inventors of the supporting arch, but its extended use in vaults and intersecting barrel shapes and domes is theirs.
author: Harry Seidler

quote: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
author: Martin Mull

quote: Engineering, medicine, business, architecture and painting are concerned not with the necessary but with the contingent - not with how things are but with how they might be - in short, with design.
author: Herbert Simon

quote: Form follows function.
author: Louis Sullivan

quote: The interior of the house personifies the private world the exterior of it is part of the outside world.
author: Stephen Gardiner

quote: I am but an architectural composer.
author: Alexander Jackson Davis

quote: The interior of the house personifies the private world the exterior of it is part of the outside world.
author: Stephen Gardiner

quote: Escape from the architecture ghetto is one of the major drivers and has been from the very beginning.
author: Rem Koolhaas

quote: I'm often called an old-fashioned modernist. But the modernists had the absurd idea that architecture could heal the world. That's impossible. And today nobody expects architects to have these grand visions any more.
author: Thom Mayne

quote: I quit college. I was studying architecture for about a year.
author: Barry Mann

quote: Architects in the past have tended to concentrate their attention on the building as a static object. I believe dynamics are more important: the dynamics of people, their interaction with spaces and environmental condition.
author: John Portman

quote: I am but an architectural composer.
author: Alexander Jackson Davis

quote: We require from buildings two kinds of goodness: first, the doing their practical duty well: then that they be graceful and pleasing in doing it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: I call architecture frozen music.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I hate vacations. If you can build buildings, why sit on the beach?
author: Philip Johnson

quote: The process I go through in the art and the architecture, I actually want it to be almost childlike. Sometimes I think it's magical.
author: Maya Lin

quote: That Moorish architecture is all over the place, of course. It affects me everywhere I see it, as it does so many people. But Brand Library was a special place to me, and I know I've paid homage to it many times in my drawings.
author: Jim Woodring

quote: My interest in architecture has always been sculptural. Most of my photography is of architecture.
author: Parker Stevenson

quote: I'm often called an old-fashioned modernist. But the modernists had the absurd idea that architecture could heal the world. That's impossible. And today nobody expects architects to have these grand visions any more.
author: Thom Mayne

quote: Look, architecture has a lot of places to hide behind, a lot of excuses. 'The client made me do this.' 'The city made me do this.' 'Oh, the budget.' I don't believe that anymore.
author: Frank Gehry

quote: Even though I build buildings and I pursue my architecture, I pursue it as an artist. I deliberately keep a tiny studio. I don't want to be an architectural firm. I want to remain an artist.
author: Maya Lin

quote: Great buildings that move the spirit have always been rare. In every case they are unique, poetic, products of the heart.
author: Arthur Erickson

quote: We require from buildings two kinds of goodness: first, the doing their practical duty well: then that they be graceful and pleasing in doing it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The Egyptian contribution to architecture was more concerned with remembering the dead than the living.
author: Stephen Gardiner

quote: Form follows function.
author: Louis Sullivan

quote: Post-Modernism was a reaction against Modernism. It came quite early to music and literature, and a little later to architecture. And I think it's still coming to computer science.
author: Larry Wall

quote: Switzerland is a small, steep country, much more up and down than sideways, and is all stuck over with large brown hotels built on the cuckoo clock style of architecture.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Architecture tends to consume everything else, it has become one's entire life.
author: Arne Jacobsen

quote: I loved logic, math, computer programming. I loved systems and logic approaches. And so I just figured architecture is this perfect combination.
author: Maya Lin

quote: As a designer, the mission with which we have been charged is simple: providing space at the right cost.
author: Harry von Zell

quote: Form follows profit is the aesthetic principle of our times.
author: Richard Rogers

quote: Opera, next to Gothic architecture, is one of the strangest inventions of Western man. It could not have been foreseen by any logical process.
author: Kenneth Clark

quote: Color in certain places has the great value of making the outlines and structural planes seem more energetic.
author: Antonio Gaudi

quote: I see the Beijing National Stadium as an architectural project. I accepted Herzog and De Meuron's invitation to collaborate on the design, and our proposal won the competition. From beginning to end, I stayed with the project. I am committed to fostering relationships between a city and its architecture.
author: Ai Weiwei

quote: Of course I know very little about architecture, and the older I get the less I know.
author: Richard Rogers

quote: Italy is full of historical buildings. And Europe holds a great history of philosophy from Greece until today. I read all those books and see these buildings, and I think of where I stand when I design my architecture.
author: Tadao Ando

quote: I believe very strongly, and have fought since many years ago - at least over 30 years ago - to get architecture not just within schools, but architecture talked about under history, geography, science, technology, art.
author: Richard Rogers

quote: The dialogue of architecture has been centered too long around the idea of truth.
author: Michael Graves

quote: When I'm in London, Claridge's is a great favourite. I'm a big fan of art deco architecture and the rooms are extraordinary.
author: Roman Coppola

quote: Architecture arouses sentiments in man. The architect's task therefore, is to make those sentiments more precise.
author: Adolf Loos

quote: Prose is architecture, not interior decoration, and the Baroque is over.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: My buildings will be my legacy... they will speak for me long after I'm gone.
author: Julia Morgan

quote: But those musics do not address the larger kind of architecture in time that classical music does, whatever each one of us knows that classical music must mean.
author: Michael Tilson Thomas

quote: I went to school for engineering, I studied jazz. So I always had this kind of creative side and technical side, and I thought architecture might be the way to combine them, so I went to architecture school in New York.
author: Joseph Kosinski

quote: Once I got out of architecture school I decided not to be an architect, I just started my own little design studio.
author: Joseph Kosinski

quote: I don't see that any buildings should be excluded from the term architecture, as long as they are done properly.
author: Arne Jacobsen

quote: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I think that one's art is a growth inside one. I do not think one can explain growth. It is silent and subtle. One does not keep digging up a plant to see how it grows.
author: Emily Carr

quote: Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: In Art, man reveals himself and not his objects.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: The beauty one can find in art is one of the pitifully few real and lasting products of human endeavor.
author: Paul Getty

quote: The art of a people is a true mirror to their minds.
author: Nehru, Jawaharial

quote: It is a sad fact about our culture that a poet can earn much more money writing or talking about his art than he can by practicing it.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: I had wanted a tape recorder since I was tiny. I thought it was a magic thing. I never got one until just before I went to art school.
author: Brian Eno

quote: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: Oh literature, oh the glorious Art, how it preys upon the marrow in our bones. It scoops the stuffing out of us, and chucks us aside. Alas!
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The arts are an even better barometer of what is happening in our world than the stock market or the debates in congress.
author: Hendrik Willem Van Loon

quote: My goal is to be one with the music. I just dedicate my whole life to this art.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: My age and health will never allow me to realize the dream of art I've been pursuing all my life.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: I am more a friend of art than a producer of painting.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Back then, I didn't have a big organization around me. I was just a kid with a guitar, traveling around. My responsibility basically was to the art, and I had extra time on my hands. There is no extra time now. There isn't enough time.
author: Joni Mitchell

quote: Another unsettling element in modern art is that common symptom of immaturity, the dread of doing what has been done before.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Vitality is radiated from exceptional art and architecture.
author: Arthur Erickson

quote: I would no more quarrel with a man because of his religion than I would because of his art.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The 1990s, after the reign of terror of academic vandalism, will be a decade of restoration: restoration of meaning, value, beauty, pleasure, and emotion to art and restoration of art to its audience.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.
author: Emile Zola

quote: It seems almost backwards to me that my music seems the more emotional outlet, and the art stuff seems more about ideas.
author: David Byrne

quote: Art is something to be proud of. Art is no compromise.
author: Christian Bale

quote: Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Every science begins as philosophy and ends as art.
author: Will Durant

quote: Progressive art can assist people to learn not only about the objective forces at work in the society in which they live, but also about the intensely social character of their interior lives. Ultimately, it can propel people toward social emancipation.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: It is not possible to overstate the influence of Paul Cezanne on twentieth-century art. He's the modern Giotto, someone who shattered one kind of picture-making and invented a new one that the world followed.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: An artist cannot speak about his art any more than a plant can discuss horticulture.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Willem de Kooning is generally credited for coming out of the painterly gates strong in the forties, revolutionizing art and abstraction and reaching incredible heights by the early fifties, and then tailing off.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: Great nations write their autobiographies in three manuscripts - the book of their deeds, the book of their words and the book of their art.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Art is always and everywhere the secret confession, and at the same time the immortal movement of its time.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The art of government is to make two-thirds of a nation pay all it possibly can pay for the benefit of the other third.
author: Voltaire

quote: The challenge is to practice politics as the art of making what appears to be impossible, possible.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: An artist cannot fail it is a success to be one.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: I've sort of escaped my background, as people often do, through art and culture.
author: Danny Boyle

quote: Not everybody trusts paintings but people believe photographs.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Art gives me the freedom I don't have when I make music.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: Can space break? I mean the space of art galleries. Over the past 100 years, art galleries have gone from looking like Beaux Arts salons to simple storefronts to industrial lofts to the gleaming giant white cubes of Chelsea with their shiny concrete floors.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: Venice is the perfect place for a phase of art to die. No other city on earth embraces entropy quite like this magical floating mall.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: Chance gives rise to thoughts, and chance removes them no art can keep or acquire them.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: All great art is the work of the whole living creature, body and soul, and chiefly of the soul.
author: John Ruskin

quote: My love of fine art increased - the more of it I saw, the more of it I wanted to see.
author: Paul Getty

quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger give, if thou art asked for little by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
author: Confucius

quote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: When you Google me, you'll find a lot of people don't like Richard Dreyfuss. Because I'm cocky and I present a cocky attitude. But no one has ever disagreed with the notion I represent, that we need more civic education. So far there's 100 percent support for that.
author: Richard Dreyfuss

quote: There's always the motivation of wanting to win. Everybody has that. But a champion needs, in his attitude, a motivation above and beyond winning.
author: Pat Riley

quote: Like success, failure is many things to many people. With Positive Mental Attitude, failure is a learning experience, a rung on the ladder, a plateau at which to get your thoughts in order and prepare to try again.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: My second husband believed I had such a fickle attitude to friendship that each Friday he would update the list of my 'Top Ten' friends in the manner of a Top Of The Pops chart countdown.
author: Julie Burchill

quote: I think my attitude to human beings has changed since leaving prison.
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote: We can do better in higher education. And it is more than just technology. It's also an attitude on the part of faculty. We need to think through how we can produce a better quality product at less cost.
author: Roy Romer

quote: Global political conditions make a direct American intervention difficult, but President Reagan's messianic and visceral attitude toward the Nicaraguan revolution could mean it will happen as an act of desperation.
author: Tomas Borge

quote: I really believe you can predict when someone has a great attitude, a real well of talent.
author: Taylor Hackford

quote: Vampires are so old that they don't need to impress anyone anymore. They're comfortable in their own skin. It's this enigmatic strength that's very romantic and old-fashioned. I think it goes back to something of a Victorian attitude of finding a strong man who's going to look after his woman.
author: Stephen Moyer

quote: It got very tedious saying the same jokes in the same way with the same attitude.
author: Norm MacDonald

quote: The best way to inspire people to superior performance is to convince them by everything you do and by your everyday attitude that you are wholeheartedly supporting them.
author: Harold S. Geneen

quote: Pink isn't just a color, it's an attitude!
author: Miley Cyrus

quote: It's a question of keeping one's eyes and ears open and watching how other people play the game. They're watching me too, to see what my attitude is like.
author: Charles Dance

quote: Today's students can put dope in their veins or hope in their brains. If they can conceive it and believe it, they can achieve it. They must know it is not their aptitude but their attitude that will determine their altitude.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Most of us start out with a positive attitude and a plan to do our best.
author: Marilu Henner

quote: Acting is magical. Change your look and your attitude, and you can be anyone.
author: Alicia Witt

quote: I'm not anti-fashion, but I've always had a bit of a punk attitude. That's important, I think. I do my own thing.
author: Sade Adu

quote: That term's definitely got a negative aura to it, because people think a diva is somebody with an attitude who demands things all the time. Of course there is that type of diva, but my idea of a diva has always been a singer - whether male or female - who gets on that stage and captivates you with their presence and their voice.
author: Jordin Sparks

quote: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.
author: Allen Klein

quote: That's what I love from metal, and that's what I love from hip-hop. That's what I love from any music that's hard, that's got an edge to it-The attitude in it.
author: Kid Rock

quote: It's a question of keeping one's eyes and ears open and watching how other people play the game. They're watching me too, to see what my attitude is like.
author: Charles Dance

quote: I always said punk was an attitude. It was never about having a Mohican haircut or wearing a ripped T-shirt. It was all about destruction, and the creative potential within that.
author: Malcolm Mclaren

quote: I love everybody. One of the great things about me is that I have a very positive attitude.
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: The American attitude towards efficiency and execution should always underlie architecture.
author: Helmut Jahn

quote: Britishness is just a way of putting things together and a certain don't care attitude about clothes. You don't care, you just do it and it looks great.
author: Vivienne Westwood

quote: The world is full of musicians who can play great, and you wouldn't cross the road to see them. It's people who have this indefinable attitude that are the good ones.
author: Nick Lowe

quote: The American attitude is 'We're the best'. That's why the NBA guys who come from other countries, the Europeans, all sort of stick together away from the game.
author: Andrew Bogut

quote: I don't know that I have any role models now that are fixed. Definitely my mom - she's the coolest. She's worked really hard her whole life and I just think she's got a great attitude. Moms just know so much it's so silly.
author: Larisa Oleynik

quote: Always keep that happy attitude. Pretend that you are holding a beautiful fragrant bouquet.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: When I first left university, I thought about going into the private sector. But I discovered when I went to interview that I could only have a career in the back office, or doing HR. The attitude was, 'My dear lady, you cannot possibly think about going on the board.'
author: Pauline Neville-Jones

quote: It's sort of a mental attitude about critical thinking and curiosity. It's about mindset of looking at the world in a playful and curious and creative way.
author: Adam Savage

quote: It goes without saying that the Jewish people can have no other goal than Palestine and that, whatever the fate of the proposition may be, our attitude toward the land of our fathers is and shall remain unchangeable.
author: Theodor Herzl

quote: I perfectly understood President Obama's attitude throughout the French presidential campaign. He had no reason to distance himself from Nicolas Sarkozy. It's the basic solidarity that leaders who worked together owe to each other.
author: Francois Hollande

quote: Good humor is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: The Dolls were an attitude. If nothing else they were a great attitude.
author: Johnny Thunders

quote: I hope 'The Voice' has a fifteen-year run, don't get me wrong. But I come from nothing, and maybe it's the Irish in me, but my attitude is always like, 'They'll figure me out soon.'
author: Carson Daly

quote: The pilot looked at his cues of attitude and speed and orientation and so on and responded as he would from the same cues in an airplane, but there was no way it flew the same. The simulators had showed us that.
author: Alan Shepard

quote: What was past was past. I suppose that was the general attitude.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: It's a question of keeping one's eyes and ears open and watching how other people play the game. They're watching me too, to see what my attitude is like.
author: Charles Dance

quote: You'd like more people to recognise what you do is special. But I take the attitude that the best thing I can do for my sport is to be the best at it. The best way people will come to recognise that track and field is a great sport is to see athletes excelling at it. Which is what I intend to do.
author: Maurice Greene

quote: The artist is not responsible to any one. His social role is asocial... his only responsibility consists in an attitude to the work he does.
author: Georg Baselitz

quote: Hardboiled crime fiction came of age in 'Black Mask' magazine during the Twenties and Thirties. Writers like Dashiell Hammett and Raymond Chandler learnt their craft and developed a distinct literary style and attitude toward the modern world.
author: Charles Frazier

quote: My attitude toward graduate students was different, I must say. I used graduate students as colleagues: I gave them the best problems to work on, and I encouraged them.
author: Frank Press

quote: So at a time in which the media give the public everything it wants and desires, maybe art should adopt a much more aggressive attitude towards the public. I myself am very much inclined to take this position.
author: Thom Mayne

quote: If a site is done with pleasure and a fun attitude, it's a great way to communicate with your fans.
author: Christopher Lambert

quote: In Scotland over many years we have cultivated through our justice system what I hope can be described as a 'culture of compassion.' On the other hand, there still exists in many parts of the U.S., if not nationally, an attitude towards the concept of justice which can only be described as a 'culture of vengeance.'
author: Keith O'Brien

quote: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.
author: Allen Klein

quote: I was kicked out of school because of my attitude. I was not assimilating. So I went to work, taking any jobs I could get.
author: Richard Pryor

quote: The minute you try to talk business with him he takes the attitude that he is a gentleman and a scholar, and the moment you try to approach him on the level of his moral integrity he starts to talk business.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: I know no subject more elevating, more amazing, more ready to the poetical enthusiasm, the philosophical reflection, and the moral sentiment than the works of nature. Where can we meet such variety, such beauty, such magnificence?
author: James Thomson

quote: One of the things that people don't realize is that that natural beauty, those recreational forests, they have an economic development impact for the state as well.
author: Ed Rendell

quote: Solitude gives birth to the original in us, to beauty unfamiliar and perilous - to poetry. But also, it gives birth to the opposite: to the perverse, the illicit, the absurd.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Beauty is not caused. It is.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: They saw me, those reckless seekers of beauty, and in a night I was famous.
author: Lillie Langtry

quote: For me the greatest beauty always lies in the greatest clarity.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: The New York City Ballet is obviously speaking to a whole new generation and bringing it the same wonder and beauty that it brought previous generations.
author: Robert Caro

quote: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: There's no such thing is aging, but maturing and knowledge. It's beautiful, I call that beauty.
author: Celine Dion

quote: I was kind of a jock in school. Beauty wasn't something I spent a lot of time on.
author: Nina Dobrev

quote: Beauty is first and foremost an emotion.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: Thankfully, beauty is easier to remove than apply, and a swipe of demaquillage in the right direction and you are you once again.
author: Margaret Cho

quote: Beauty is power a smile is its sword.
author: John Ray

quote: People often say that 'beauty is in the eye of the beholder,' and I say that the most liberating thing about beauty is realizing that you are the beholder. This empowers us to find beauty in places where others have not dared to look, including inside ourselves.
author: Salma Hayek

quote: My beauty icon is Angelina Jolie.
author: Ashley Benson

quote: When a girl ceases to blush, she has lost the most powerful charm of her beauty.
author: Gregory I

quote: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Order is the shape upon which beauty depends.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: I love my beauty. It's not my fault.
author: Valentino Garavani

quote: I needed to be in the bush. There I find solitude and beauty and purity and focus. That's where my heart lies.
author: Mark Burnett

quote: I think exercise tests us in so many ways, our skills, our hearts, our ability to bounce back after setbacks. This is the inner beauty of sports and competition, and it can serve us all well as adult athletes.
author: Peggy Fleming

quote: The pleasure we derive from the representation of the present is due, not only to the beauty it can be clothed in, but also to its essential quality of being the present.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: I'm really proud of myself because I've pared my beauty regimen down to a cream blush and berry-tinted lip balm, which has saved me so much time.
author: Katherine Heigl

quote: We also maintain - again with perfect truth - that mystery is more than half of beauty, the element of strangeness that stirs the senses through the imagination.
author: Richard Le Gallienne

quote: My beauty secret is absolutely no sun.
author: Vivienne Westwood

quote: I have no right to beauty. I had been condemned to masculine ugliness.
author: Renee Vivien

quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
author: Aristotle

quote: We didn't have a beauty shop as I grew up.
author: Jenifer Lewis

quote: Beauty is the result of having been through an experience all the way through to the end - therefore it has a poignancy. Beauty that is singular always comes from following an experience to the point where you can go no further.
author: Joan Chen

quote: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: People see you as an object, not as a person, and they project a set of expectations onto you. People who don't have it think beauty is a blessing, but actually it sets you apart.
author: Candice Bergen

quote: There's a sadness to the human condition that I think music is good for. It gives a counterpoint to the visual beauty, and adds depth to pictures that they wouldn't have if the music wasn't there.
author: Mike Figgis

quote: You can't possibly fathom the ins and outs of a prepubescent beauty treatment until you've felt the strange but exhilarating tingle of a cottage-cheese-and-Pop-Rocks facial.
author: Sloane Crosley

quote: It is something to be able to paint a particular picture, or to carve a statue, and so to make a few objects beautiful; but it is far moreglorious to carve and paint the very atmosphere and medium through which we look, which morally we can do. To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts.
author: Thoreau, Henry David

quote: The ideal has many names, and beauty is but one of them.
author: Ninon de L'Enclos

quote: If you don't die of thirst, there are blessings in the desert. You can be pulled into limitlessness, which we all yearn for, or you can do the beauty of minutiae, the scrimshaw of tiny and precise. The sky is your ocean, and the crystal silence will uplift you like great gospel music, or Neil Young.

quote: I felt Joyce was an influence on my fiction, but in a very general way, as a kind of inspiration and a model for the beauty of language.

quote: My sisters and I were fortunate to travel through Asia and Europe at very young ages. We confronted extraordinary beauty in Athens and unspeakable poverty in India.

quote: Through Kurt I saw the beauty of minimalism and the importance of music that's stripped down.

quote: I'm really proud of myself because I've pared my beauty regimen down to a cream blush and berry-tinted lip balm, which has saved me so much time.

quote: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.

quote: Proportions are what makes the old Greek temples classic in their beauty. They are like huge blocks, from which the air has been literally hewn out between the columns.

quote: Ads featuring real women and real beauty are such a necessary component to offset the potentially dangerous programming out there for little girls.

quote: Beauty doesn't need ornaments. Softness can't bear the weight of ornaments.

quote: I would like to say to people, open your eyes and find beauty where you normally don't expect it.

quote: There is beauty when something works and it works intuitively.

quote: Beauty and fullness of tone can be achieved by having the whole orchestra play with high clarinets and a carefully selected number of piccolos.

quote: Seek goodness and be goodness. Seek beauty and be beauty. Seek love and be love.

quote: I think there's a great beauty to having problems. That's one of the ways we learn.

quote: I consider my ability to arouse enthusiasm among men the greatest asset I possess. The way to develop the best that is in a man is by appreciation and encouragement.

quote: Some people have such a talent for making the best of a bad situation that they go around creating bad situations so they can make the best of them.

quote: I have a terrific marriage, but unlike a lot of relationships where they ebb and flow, no matter what happens you fall deeper and deeper in love every day. It's kind of the best thing that can happen to you. It's thrilling.

quote: Laughter is the best medicine - unless you're diabetic, then insulin comes pretty high on the list.

quote: It's easy to get wrapped up in sharing everyday life with a partner. It's fun to get lost in love and romance. It's the best. But holding on to yourself while doing that is the most important thing.

quote: Progress however, of the best kind, is comparatively slow. Great results cannot be achieved at once and we must be satisfied to advance in life as we walk, step by step.

quote: In war as in life, it is often necessary when some cherished scheme has failed, to take up the best alternative open, and if so, it is folly not to work for it with all your might.

quote: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.

quote: There are times when even the best manager is like the little boy with the big dog, waiting to see where the dog wants to go so he can take him there.

quote: Walking is man's best medicine.

quote: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.

quote: Meditation is all about the pursuit of nothingness. It's like the ultimate rest. It's better than the best sleep you've ever had. It's a quieting of the mind. It sharpens everything, especially your appreciation of your surroundings. It keeps life fresh.

quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

quote: If you want to go somewhere, it is best to find someone who has already been there.

quote: There is only one real sin and that is to persuade oneself that the second best is anything but second best.

quote: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: There are two way of establishing a reputation, one to be praised by honest people and the other to be accused by rogues. It is best, however, to secure the first one, because it will always be accompanied by the latter.

quote: I live with some of my best friends from high school, very commune-like, in my house. It's my hippie way of life.

quote: Fit no stereotypes. Don't chase the latest management fads. The situation dictates which approach best accomplishes the team's mission.

quote: Old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
author: Athenaeus

quote: In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact to shatter and destroy it is not so good.

quote: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: I just need to know that I did the very best I could and that I was true to myself.

quote: One man's ways may be as good as another's, but we all like our own best.

quote: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be.

quote: In giving freedom to the slave, we assure freedom to the free - honorable alike in what we give and what we preserve. We shall nobly save, or meanly lose, the last best hope of earth.

quote: To help yourself, you must be yourself. Be the best that you can be. When you make a mistake, learn from it, pick yourself up and move on.

quote: To refrain from imitation is the best revenge.

quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.

quote: If I am a cup maker, I'm interested in making the best cup I possibly can. My effort goes into that cup, not what people think about it.

quote: Real education should consist of drawing the goodness and the best out of our own students. What better books can there be than the book of humanity?

quote: Words empty as the wind are best left unsaid.

quote: One of the best parts of growing older? You can flirt all you like since you've become harmless.

quote: The 1st period is won by the best technician. The 2nd period is won by the kid in the best shape. The 3rd period is won by the kid with the biggest heart.

quote: The promises of this world are, for the most part, vain phantoms and to confide in one's self, and become something of worth and value is the best and safest course.

quote: Not to be born is, past all prizing, best.

quote: The intention to live as long as possible isn't one of the mind's best intentions, because quantity isn't the same as quality.

quote: If anything I try to write something that would be more difficult to film. I tend to see film as competition and would like instead to do what books do best.

quote: When one is trying to do something beyond his known powers it is useless to seek the approval of friends. Friends are at their best in moments of defeat.

quote: If you play it straight it's funny - the best comedy is always played straight down the middle. The adjustment is understanding from the screenplay that a moment is hilarious.
author: Tom Hiddleston

quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Meditation is all about the pursuit of nothingness. It's like the ultimate rest. It's better than the best sleep you've ever had. It's a quieting of the mind. It sharpens everything, especially your appreciation of your surroundings. It keeps life fresh.

quote: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals separated from law and justice he is the worst.

quote: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.

quote: Sometimes you get the best light from a burning bridge.

quote: In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else.

quote: The best place a person can die, is where they die for others.

quote: The best thing is to look natural, but it takes makeup to look natural.

quote: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can.

quote: You know, we'd just had a birthday, he was... you know, he still had a future out of him, and all I can is he was just one of the most beautiful people in the world... a very gifted man, and it's a loss to the world, not just for us.

quote: We didn't have a whole lot of money when I was growing up either. I would always ask for magic books or magic tricks for my birthday or for Christmas and the rest of the year I either had to mow lawns or find part time jobs to help supplement the cost of doing magic.

quote: Our birthdays are feathers in the broad wing of time.

quote: My mom and my father's birthday are on the same day.

quote: I've got some incredible fans actually - so loyal and they make me birthday cards and Christmas cards. I got this package of poems and artwork based around the songs. quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?

quote: I was quite a shy child. I would get terribly nervous and throw up before my birthday party. And then I would be fine. I feel the same now. I get nervous, then it's fine.

quote: I love having my birthday at Australia Zoo.

quote: And for the city's birthday, we will host events in every neighborhood of the city, inviting all of our residents to share in the celebration of Boston's great epic - the story of neighbors who support one another where it matters most.

quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.

quote: I had arranged a birthday party for him and my children, who are all Aquarians. Instead, we got married. I ran out of excuses. It was just us and my children.

quote: I'm trying to get the record that I made at my birthday party last year, trying to get that out, and the lawyers are diddling around with it and it probably won't be out until next year. I don't know.

quote: Every year on your birthday, you get a chance to start new.

quote: I saw Richard Linklater's film 'Slacker' for my twenty-first birthday. That was the moment when it all seemed possible. This guy gave me hope.

quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to remember it once.

quote: The first guitar I ever got was for my 13th birthday.

quote: For my birthday this year, my girlfriends - who knew I'd just inherited my dad's turntable - gave me a carton of albums like 'Blue Kentucky Girl,' by Emmylou Harris, and 'Off the Wall,' by Michael Jackson. It's all stuff we grew up with. I mean, you can't have a music collection without Prince's 'Purple Rain' - it just can't be done!

quote: Handmade presents are scary because they reveal that you have too much free time.

quote: I get uncomfortable when people give me presents and watch me open them. I don't have birthday parties, because the idea of a group of people singing and looking at me while I'm blowing out candles gives me hives.

quote: My mom FedExes a red velvet cake she makes from scratch to me every birthday.
author: Molly Sims

quote: I hate birthdays. I hate birthday parties. I hate them. I don't know what it is, anybody's only got to come wafting near me with a piece of cake with a candle on and I break out in hives.

quote: I'm a summer baby, so I usually have my birthday as a good summer memory.
author: Sloane Crosley

quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

quote: On my birthday, I was in Milan for the collections.

quote: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.

quote: I cried on my 18th birthday. I thought 17 was such a nice age. You're young enough to get away with things, but you're old enough, too.

quote: In 1993 my birthday present was a star on Hollywood's Walk of Fame.

quote: Mum loves me being famous! She is so excited and proud, as she had me so young and couldn't support me, so I am living her dream, it's sweeter for both of us. It's her 40th birthday soon and I'm going to buy her 40 presents.

quote: I always wanted to shave. It is a very natural process. For my birthday I got a lot of shaving stuff.

quote: I'm trying to get the record that I made at my birthday party last year, trying to get that out, and the lawyers are diddling around with it and it probably won't be out until next year. I don't know.
author: Marian McPartland

quote: I did a cake for the 60th birthday of Elton John, for Britney Spears' 27th birthday and for the 'Circus' album she put out - the cake had circus themes. I prepared a cake for a surprise 82nd birthday event for the architect Frank Gehry the cake was comprised of mini-replicas of his buildings.

quote: And for the city's birthday, we will host events in every neighborhood of the city, inviting all of our residents to share in the celebration of Boston's great epic - the story of neighbors who support one another where it matters most.
author: Thomas Menino

quote: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.

quote: For my birthday I got a humidifier and a de-humidifier... I put them in the same room and let them fight it out.

quote: Let us celebrate the occasion with wine and sweet words.

quote: I hate birthdays. I hate birthday parties. I hate them. I don't know what it is, anybody's only got to come wafting near me with a piece of cake with a candle on and I break out in hives.

quote: All the world is birthday cake, so take a piece, but not too much.
